text: Bertrand Delanoë (; born 30 May 1950) is a retired French politician. He was Mayor of Paris from 25 March 2001 to 5 April 2014. He is a member of the Socialist Party. He was born in Tunis, French Tunisia. Delanoë was stabbed on 5 October 2002 during the Nuit Blanche, a night of festivities in Paris. Before being taken to hospital, Delanoë ordered that the festivities continue. Delanoë's wound was not life-threatening and he left the hospital after about two weeks. Delanoë was one of the first major French politicians to announce that he was gay.City Mayors: Bertrand Delanoe – Mayor of Paris ==References== ==Other websites== * Bertrand Delanoë's web site * Paris and beaches *The Mayor of Paris, from www.paris.fr *BBC report on stabbing *CityMayors.com profile * Poll of Parisians on Delanoë, January 2006 Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:French crime victims Category:French LGBT people Category:Gay men Category:LGBT politicians Category:French LGBT rights activists Category:Mayors of Paris Category:Politicians from Tunis Category:Socialist Party (France) politicians Category:Recipients of the Order of the Rising Sun
title: Bertrand Delanoë
